Carlos Quihuis' Portfolio

Introduction

Hi my name is Carlos Quihuis, but my friends call me Kiwis, I'm a Computer Science Junior at Arizona State University specializing in Artificial Intelligence and Data Systems. Seeking for internship opportunities for summer 2024 and onwards.

About Me

I am a Computer Science Junior at Arizona State University, focusing on Artificial Intelligence and Data Systems. I possess professional expertise in software and computer systems engineering. My technical skills encompass programming languages, front-end development, tools, databases, and operating systems. Additionally, I co-founded a decentralized payment system and completed notable projects, including a chess AI and a face recognition app. I have also participated in numerous hackathons and coding contests where I gained valuable experience on teamwork.

Projects

PiePay

  • Created a decentralized payment system that allowed users to split the bill on online purchases. Deployed smart contracts on both the Solana and Ethereum network.

    • AI coffee recipe generator

  • Made a website that receives user input and will output a recipe including ingredients and instructions of the specified drink. Utilized OpenAI API to perform smart predictions and Flask to deploy it.

    • Who are you?

  • Developed an app that used face recognition to analyze each facial property and matches them with their respective profile. Used the Python standard libraries and Haar cascade library.
